text: Liturgy is like a strong tree whose beauty is derived from the continuous renewal of its leaves, but whose strength comes from the old trunk, with solid roots in the ground.
author: Pope Paul VI

text: Beauty is merciless. You do not look at it, it looks at you and does not forgive.
author: Nikos Kazantzakis

text: People often say that 'beauty is in the eye of the beholder,' and I say that the most liberating thing about beauty is realizing that you are the beholder. This empowers us to find beauty in places where others have not dared to look, including inside ourselves.
author: Salma Hayek

text: Beauty opened all the doors it got me things I didn't even know I wanted, and things I certainly didn't deserve.
author: Janice Dickinson

text: Soon I realized that if beauty equalled forgiveness, I was never going to be forgiven.
author: Kevyn Aucoin
